clues.text: After "Achy Breaky Heart", his debut CD "Some Gave All" hit No. 1 on the country & pop charts
At the age of 13, this performer topped the country charts with "Delta Dawn"
A year before he recorded "By The Time I Get to Phoenix", he played guitar on the Beach Boys' "Good Vibrations"
In October 1991 this singer quit "Killin' Time" long enough to marry Lisa Hartman
His 1991 music video "The Thunder Rolls" created controversy because of its violence
This rocky British crown colony is known as "Gib" for short
This Southern state's motto is "Wisdom, Justice and Moderation"
You'll find the Kelvingrove Art Galleries & Museum in this Scottish city
Syros, Skyros & Skiathos are just 3 of this Balkan country's many islands
Most of the Indians in this Central American country speak one of the Maya languages
After taking up with John Lennon, she became known as "The Woman Who Broke Up the Beatles"
With help from miracle worker Anne Sullivan, she graduated from Radcliffe with honors in 1904
This woman for whom the Tony Awards are named was a descendant of Mayflower Pilgrim John Howland
She created TV's "All My Children" while working as a writer for "The Guiding Light"
From 1973 to 1983 she was Rolling Stone magazine's chief photographer
Until the 1880s, this animal was the principal source of food for the Plains Indians
In addition to cultivating Pocahontas, John Rolfe learned to cultivate this cash crop from the Indians
The Chippewa name for this bird is kookookoo-ooh
Red Cloud & Crazy Horse were members of the Oglalla branch of this tribe
In 1828 this tribe began publishing a weekly newspaper using their new alphabet
The main purpose of a red blood cell is to carry this gas from your lungs to the rest of your body
The sun spends its days & nights converting this gas into helium
Baking powder produces this gas
It's the common nickname of nitrous oxide
Produced by the decay of plant & animal matter, this colorless & odorless gas, CH<sub>4</sub>, is flammable
In 1984 films, Robert Ginty was "The Exterminator" & he was "The Terminator"
In "On Golden Pond" he played Norman Thayer
David Lynch directed this 1980 tale about John Merrick
In this 1982 film Lou Gossett drills Richard Gere & Debra Winger thrills him
Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer & Cher were this title group

clues.text: He died in Vienna March 26, 1827, during a thunderstorm like the one depicted in his Pastoral Symphony
Death defeated him March 16, 1971, 23 years after Truman did
This Scotsman died March 11, 1955, 10 years after he won a Nobel Prize for his 1928 discovery of penicillin
Crispus Attucks, an African American, was one of 5 men killed in this Beantown event March 5, 1770
This British statesman whose 1917 declaration supported a Jewish homeland died in England March 19, 1930
This "Hollaback Girl" took a cinematic turn, playing Jean Harlow in "The Aviator"
"The Emancipation of Mimi" & "E=MC<sup>2</sup> are albums from this multi-octave gal
This "lady" took her stage name from a Queen song after she was likened to Freddie Mercury
Last name Kilcher, she restyled herself as a country singer in 2008 with the album "Perfectly Clear"
With a name like a Wild West outlaw, she set off some alarms with her 2009 country-pop tune "Blue Jeans"

rounds.category: WHAT AM I GOING TO WEAR?

clues.text: 1st popular in the 1960s, these pants are named for the area below the waistline where they embrace the body
Every woman should have one of these, LBD for short
Complete the look of the powder blue tuxedo with a ruffled one of these detachable false shirt fronts
Making a comeback for women in 2009, these 5-letter pants, aka genie pants & worn by MC Hammer, were too legit to quit
The name of this Tyrolean get-up is German for "leather trousers"
It might be crewel to tell you that the Bayeux Tapestry is an example of this kind of needlework
A humanoid robot
For spreading this disease, food handler Mary Mallon spent the last 23 years of her life in detention
Take these anabolic lipids only under a doctor's supervision
Because it carries 2 sets of chromosomes, a zygote is this type of cell
In Rimsky-Korsakov's "The Maid of Pskov", this notorious 16th c. czar destroys the city of Novgorod
In "Maria Stuarda", this queen signs Mary Stuart's death warrant after being called a bastard
On Feb. 26, 1776 a fire destroyed Milan's Royal Ducal Theatre; this replaced it
This Gian Carlo Menotti TV opera features a crippled boy, his mother & 3 kings: Kaspar, Melchior & Balthazar
This Johann Strauss opera has appeared in several English versions, including "Night Birds" & "Rosalinda"

rounds.text: Teddy Roosevelt called it "the one great sight which every American should see"
